titleStmt.title: [Joy after sorrow], being the sea-mans return from Jamaica:, or, The lovely lasses late lamentation for the long absence of her dearest beloved friend a voyage to Jamaica he pretends: but at his comming home makes her amends. To an excellent new tune, called, My love is gone to Bohemy, or, Wet and weary.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

titleStmt.title: [Joy after sorrow], being the sea-mans return from Jamaica:, or, The lovely lasses late lamentation for the long absence of her dearest beloved friend a voyage to Jamaica he pretends: but at his comming home makes her amends. To an excellent new tune, called, My love is gone to Bohemy, or, Wet and weary.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Tho. Vere at the Signe of the Angel without New-gate,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Imperfect: broadside is cropped with slight loss of print.
